Description:
Manage and supervise the daily operations and tasks that take place within the accounting department of the company.
Analysing the differences and deviations resulting from the comparison of actual expected revenues and expenses, and identifying the reasons for the fundamental deviations.
Organizing and preparing annual inventories.
Implementation and application of appropriate accounting methods, principles and policies.
Developing and applying new systems in accounting for collecting and analysing information and writing reports on it.
Work directly with employees in the finance department and the financial manager.
Closing accounts at the end of a month and at the end of a year.
Review and approval of payment and receipt vouchers.
Calculating the cash revenues collected by the company and implementing and monitoring the inventory of capital assets.
Monitoring the general ledger.
Supervising the process of paying salaries and all payments and expenses.
Preparing and managing budgets.
Make suggestions.
Improving the company's financial accounting systems and procedures.
Defining projects and assigning team members to work on them in the best way to achieve the goals.
Achieving the goals of financial accounting.
Create and maintain financial files and records to document all transactions and movements that have been made.
Planning, implementing and supervising the company's comprehensive accounting strategies.
Recruitment of new employees in the Accounting and Finance Department.
Recording financial and economic operations in a comprehensive and orderly way.
Classification, recording, posting, and summarizing, in addition to writing, organizing, and arranging financial transactions and presenting them in a way that allows users to understand them.
Preparing periodic reports containing income statements and an analysis of debts and cash flow.
